data.title: Eliza Jane Taylor – Biography, History, Age, Weight, Height, Relationships
data.meta_description: Eliza Jane Taylor- Biography Eliza Jane Taylor, better known as Eliza Taylor, is a renowned Australian actress. Janae Timmins on the Australian soap opera
data.text:
Eliza Jane Taylor- Biography

Eliza Jane Taylor, better known as Eliza Taylor, is a renowned Australian actress. Janae Timmins on the Australian soap opera Neighbors (2005–08) and Clarke Griffin on the classic sci-fi series The 100 (2014–2020) were her best-known performances. She publicly announced that she and her husband, Bob Morley, were expecting her first child. The good news was shared on social networks by fans and followers of the couple.

What is the estate of Eliza Jane Taylor? Salary, Earnings

Eliza Taylor has been valued at over $4 million as of around February 2022. Her wealth was earned through her acting career. Eliza won a role as Sarah Redding in the 2003 television series Pirate Islands. She has also appeared in several television episodes, including The Sleepover Club in 2003, Neighbors from 2003 to 2008, and The 100, as well as movies such as Six Plots, Patrick, and November Man.

Eliza Taylor played the eponymous character in a production of Snowhite in Weymouth, England, from 2007 to 2008. She also owns an estate in Los Angeles and a Bentley valued between $189,900 and $335,600.

Eliza Jane Taylor- Birth, Age, Ethnicity, Siblings, Education

Eliza Jane Taylor-Cotter was born on October 24, 1989 in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. Janae Timmins on the Australian series Neighbors (2005–08) and Clarke Griffin on The CW television drama The 100 (2014–present) were her best known roles. She wanted to be a marine biologist when she was younger.

Eliza completed her high school education at Calder High School. She is the youngest of two siblings, a brother and a sister. Her mother is a graphic artist and novelist, while her father owned a cafe with locations all over Melbourne. Taylor’s stepfather was a stand-up comedian. She graduated from Calder High School and is currently enrolled at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA).

Eliza Jane Taylor- Relationship, married life

Taylor’s husband’s name is Bob Morley. Eliza Taylor stated on Twitter on June 7, 2019 that she and her 100 co-stars of her Bob Morley had married. She was previously linked to Lincoln Lewis, however neither of them confirmed her relationship, and she was also linked to Brett Tucker. Jane Taylor, on the other hand, keeps much of her personal life private, so little is known about her past relationships. Eliza and her long-time friend, Claire Wyndham, established Koh Tao International Primary, a non-profit primary school in Ko Tao, Thailand, in 2017.

Eliza Jane Taylor- Professional Career

She made her film debut as Sarah Redding in Pirate Islands when she was 14 years old. In 2003, she played Rosie Cartwright in The Sleepover Club, following a breakout role in Pirate Islands. With a guest appearance on Blue Heelers in 2003, she transitioned into shows for older audiences. Taylor, like many other Australian actors, rose to fame on the 2005 Australian soap opera Neighbours. After guest starring in 2003, she was cast as Janae Timmins. Taylor auditioned for the role of Lana Crawford, but actress Bridget Neval was ultimately cast.

Executive producer Ric Pellizzeri fired Nell Feeney and Sianoa Smit-McPhee, who played Taylor’s on-screen mother Janelle Timmins and sister Bree Timmins, in 2007, even though they planned to have Taylor-Cotter stay on as Janae. Taylor-Cotter left the show later that year to pursue other interests such as pantomime and a career in the United States. Taylor-choice Cotter’s was inspired by the fact that most of her on-screen relatives had been eliminated, and the ensemble members gave the series a fresh vibe.

“It just didn’t feel like the community I joined three years ago,” he continued. Taylor-Cotter was one of numerous cast members to abruptly leave the show. The Taylor-final Cotter studio scenes were completed in 2007 and her farewell episode aired on February 8, 2008. Taylor was nominated for Actress at the 2007 Inside Soap Awards. In late November 2007 she visited the UK and on December 1, 2007, he switched on the Christmas lights in Weymouth.

Taylor appeared as Snow White in a Christmas play in Weymouth on December 19. She starred in All Saints in 2009 and directed The Laundromat, a drama/comedy short film. Taylor made an appearance in the horror film 6plots. She later appeared in the pilot episode of Winners & Losers. On March 1, 2013, Taylor was cast as Clarke Griffin, the lead in The CW’s upcoming post-apocalyptic television drama The 100.

The show debuted on March 19, 2014 at 9 p.m. Netflix Xmas romance romantic drama Christmas Inheritance.
